bioghist.p: Novelist and playwright Joseph K. Caldwell was born on October 2, 1928, in Milwaukee, Wisconsin. His education included studies at Marquette University, Columbia University, and three years in the graduate program of the School of Drama at Yale University. Caldwell's plays have been produced off-Broadway, as well as being transformed into television scripts. New York productions of his plays include Cockeyed Kite at the Actors' Playhouse, The Downtown Holy Lady at the Greenwich Mews Theatre, and Jack Fallon, Fare Thee Well by the Joseph Jefferson Theatre Company. The School of Drama at Yale University produced two of his plays, namely, The Bridge and Clay for the Statues of Saints. Caldwell may be more widely known for his four novels, published between 1978 and 1992. In Such Dark Places (1978), for which Caldwell was awarded an American Academy in Rome Fellowship in Creative Writing in 1979, was his first novel. Following In Such Dark Places, Caldwell wrote Deer at the River (1984), Under the Dog Star (1987), and The Uncle From Rome (1992). Caldwell's most recent novel, Bread for the Baker's Child, was published by Sarabande Books in 2002.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of the papers of Joseph Caldwell. Materials include: typescripts of The Cockeyed Kite, Bread for the Baker's Child, Mystery of the Body, The Idiot's Tale, The Pig Did It, The Pig Comes to Dinner, and several short stories; autograph pages from Bread for the Baker's Child and Mystery of the Body; articles, and plays; and a producer's copy of The Cockeyed Kite. Correspondence includes letters to Caldwell from friends, family, colleagues, and publishers, as well as a few letters from Caldwell to others. The correspondence includes letters from Yaddo and the MacDowell colony. Other materials in the collection include: drafts of works by other writers, including Andrew Kappel, Jess Grett, and Allan Gurganus; photographs; awards; programs, calendars and appointment books; contracts and documents related to copyright; magazines in which Caldwell's writings appear; records related to writing courses taught by Caldwell; reviews; posters; sheet music; and Caldwell's will.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
